prompt: <description>Part 1: A rectangular metal plate with three holes along its length. 1. Create a new coordinate system with the following parameters: ```json "Euler Angles": [ 0.0, 0.0, 0.0 ], "Translation Vector": [ 0.0, 0.0, 0.0 ] ``` 2. Draw a 2D sketch on the X-Y plane of the new coordinate system. 3. Create the first face of the sketch as follows: a. Draw a line from (0.125, 0) to (0.625, 0). b. Draw an arc with a start point at (0.625, 0), a mid point at (0.75, 0.125), and an end point at (0.625, 0.25). c. Draw a line from (0.625, 0.25) to (0.125, 0.25). d. Draw an arc with a start point at (0.125, 0.25), a mid point at (0.0, 0.125), and an end point at (0.125, 0). 4. Create three circular loops with the following parameters: a. Loop 2: Draw a circle with a center at (0.125, 0.125) and a radius of 0.0319. b. Loop 3: Draw a circle with a center at (0.375, 0.125) and a radius of 0.0319. c. Loop 4: Draw a circle with a center at (0.625, 0.125) and a radius of 0.0319. 5. Scale the 2D sketch with a scaling factor of 0.75. 6. Transform the scaled 2D sketch into a 3D sketch using the euler angles and translation vector defined by the coordinate system. 7. Extrude the sketch along the Z-axis with an extrusion depth of 0.0156. The resulting part should have the following dimensions: - Length: 0.75 m (0.75 m) - Width: 0.75 m (0.75 m) - Height: 0.0156 m</description>
